text: The 2018 European Junior Badminton Championships were held at the Kalev Sports Hall in Tallinn, Estonia, between 7-16 September 2018. ==Medalists== {| |- |rowspan=2 | Boys' Singles | rowspan=2 | Arnaud Merklé | rowspan=2 | Christo Popov | Lukas Resch |- | Nhat Nguyen |- | rowspan=2 |Girls' singles | rowspan=2 | Line Christophersen | rowspan=2 | Amalie Schulz | Réka Madarász |- | Vivien Sándorházi |- | rowspan=2 |Boys' doubles | rowspan=2 | Fabien Delrue William Villeger | rowspan=2 | Chris Grimley Matt Grimley | Mads Muurholm Mads Vestergaard |- | Maxime Briot Kenji Lovang |- | rowspan=2 |Girls' doubles | rowspan=2 | Bengisu Erçetin Nazlıcan İnci | rowspan=2 | Amalie Magelund Freja Ravn | Ece Sare Başakın Zehra Erdem |- | Anastasiya Prozorova Valeriya Rudakova |- | rowspan=2 | Mixed doubles | rowspan=2 | Fabien Delrue Juliette Moinard | rowspan=2 | Wessel van der Aar Alyssa Tirtosentono | Lukas Resch Emma Moszczynski |- | Mads Vestergaard Christine Busch |- | rowspan=2 |Teams | rowspan=2 | | rowspan=2 | | |- | |} ==Medal table== ==References== Category:European Junior Badminton Championships European Junior Badminton Championships European Junior Badminton Championships European Junior Badminton Championships Category:International sports competitions hosted by Estonia
title: 2018 European Junior Badminton Championships
